intro: Hemizonia wrightii var. kelloggii, commonly known as the Kellogg's hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid to semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
